intro: Matelea glandulosa, commonly known as the sticky leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. The plant's unique morphology and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
